update.description:
Finally the building editor is here, and sorry it's going to be a big pull request.

There are already a few known issues reported (issues #360 ~ issue #375)

Outstanding work includes code refactoring, and cleaning up the CSG code which has been implemented but not yet integrated, and I'll file separate tickets for these later.
update.title: Building editor code

update.description:
Finally the building editor is here, and sorry it's going to be a big pull request.

There are already a few known issues reported (issues #360 ~ issue #375)

Outstanding work includes code refactoring, and cleaning up the CSG code which has been implemented but not yet integrated, and I'll file separate tickets for these later.
update.title: Building editor code

content.raw: Editor's screen space should be fixed and dependent on the parent widget. I gave it a default size and users will be able to scroll within the graphics view, so should have no problem on a smaller laptop. There is a ticket for auto expanding scene - issue #401
content.html: Editor's screen space should be fixed and dependent on the parent widget. I gave it a default size and users will be able to scroll within the graphics view, so should have no problem on a smaller laptop. There is a ticket for auto expanding scene - issue #401

content.raw: this overrides Qt function, so kept to lower case
content.html: this overrides Qt function, so kept to lower case

content.raw: I am hoping that we could reuse these events given that there should only be one editor open at the a time (either building editor or model editor). So I will leave it in the editor namespace for now.
content.html: I am hoping that we could reuse these events given that there should only be one editor open at the a time (either building editor or model editor). So I will leave it in the editor namespace for now.

content.raw: The other shortcut is `Save World` in the `File` menu which will be disabled when gazebo is in the building editor mode so it does not cause a conflict
content.html: The other shortcut is Save World in the File menu which will be disabled when gazebo is in the building editor mode so it does not cause a conflict

content.raw: Uppercase the first letter of function name.
content.html: Uppercase the first letter of function name.

content.raw: Uppercase the first letter of function name.
content.html: Uppercase the first letter of function name.

content.raw: Uppercase the first letter of function name.
content.html: Uppercase the first letter of function name.

content.raw: Should this class be renamed to "BuildingManip"?
It seems like "MyNamedModel" is used multiple places. Is it possible to set this string once?
content.html: It seems like "MyNamedModel" is used multiple places. Is it possible to set this string once?

content.raw: This class should probably be renamed to `FinishBuildingDiaglog`
content.html: This class should probably be renamed to FinishBuildingDiaglog

content.raw: Documentation for this class, and it's member variables.
content.html: Documentation for this class, and it's member variables.

content.raw: Remove all the spaces between each class forward declaration.
content.html: Remove all the spaces between each class forward declaration.

content.raw: All of these signals should be CamelCased with the first letter capitalized.
content.html: All of these signals should be CamelCased with the first letter capitalized.

content.raw: Change names of building editor specific events to have the word `building` in them somewhere.
content.html: Change names of building editor specific events to have the word building in them somewhere.

content.raw: Remove this line, and all the zero poses. The default pose is all zeros.
content.html: Remove this line, and all the zero poses. The default pose is all zeros.

content.raw: Use SDF_VERSION from "gazebo/sdf/sdf.hh". For example: `"<sdf version='" << SDF_VERSION << "'>"`
content.html: Use SDF_VERSION from "gazebo/sdf/sdf.hh". For example: "<sdf version='" << SDF_VERSION << "'>"

content.raw: Add more documentation in this function please.
content.html: Add more documentation in this function please.

content.raw: This function is large enough to warrant some amount of code documentation.
content.html: This function is large enough to warrant some amount of code documentation.
